fgeo.tool 0.0.0.9002
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • Read, combine, identify, and write multiple files
  • Changelog
  • fgeo

Save each dataframe in a list to a different .csv file.

Source: R/ls_manipulate_lists.R
ls_csv_df.Rd

A useful complement of this function is ls_list_spreadsheets().

ls_csv_df(df_list, dir, prefix = NULL)

Arguments

df_list

A list of dataframes.
dir

Character; the directory where the files will be saved.
prefix

Character; a prefix to add to the file names.

Source

Adapted from an article by Jenny Bryan (https://goo.gl/ah8qkX).

See also

ls_list_spreadsheets.

Other functions to handle multiple spreadsheets of an excel workbook.: ls_list_spreadsheets

Examples

path_to_excel_workbook <- system.file(
  "extdata", "example.xlsx", package = "fgeo.tool"
)

df_list <- ls_list_spreadsheets(path_to_excel_workbook)
str(df_list)

output <- tempdir()
ls_csv_df(df_list, output, prefix = "myfile-")

files <- dir(output)
files[grepl(".csv$", files)]
#> [1] "myfile-Existing_stems.csv"      "myfile-Field Meta Data.csv"    
#> [3] "myfile-Form Meta Data.csv"      "myfile-new_secondary_stems.csv"
#> [5] "myfile-orignal_stems.csv"       "myfile-Recruits.csv"           
#> [7] "myfile-Root.csv"                "myfile-Start_page.csv"
